title: NixOS Package PRs for qc, spectacle, keepassxc, pipewire, bind-9.18.14, bcache-tools packages
description: NixOS Package PRs for qc, spectacle, keepassxc, pipewire, bind-9.18.14, bcache-tools packages on GitHub

items.content_html:
It's generally more reliable than Pulse these days, and Pulse also has a weird interaction with Plasma where the sound is muted on boot.

Description of changes

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin
  • For non-Linux: Is sandboxing enabled in nix.conf? (See Nix manual)
    • sandbox = relaxed
    • sandbox = true
  • Tested, as applicable:
    • NixOS test(s) (look inside nixos/tests)
    • and/or package tests
    • or, for functions and "core" functionality, tests in lib/tests or pkgs/test
    • made sure NixOS tests are linked to the relevant packages
  • Tested compilation of all packages that depend on this change using nix-shell -p nixpkgs-review --run "nixpkgs-review rev HEAD". Note: all changes have to be committed, also see nixpkgs-review usage
  • Tested basic functionality of all binary files (usually in ./result/bin/)
  • 24.11 Release Notes (or backporting 23.11 and 24.05 Release notes)
    • (Package updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is major or breaking
    • (Module updates) Added a release notes entry if the change is significant
    • (Module addition) Added a release notes entry if adding a new NixOS module
  • Fits CONTRIBUTING.md.

items.title: nixos/*: use pipewire by default

items.content_html:
Description of changes

webrtc-audio-processing only supports specific architectures, so for unsupported architectures, we have to disable it for pipewire to build.

items.title: pipewire: disable webrtc-audio-processing if unavailable

items.content_html:
Description of changes

i3status-rust has recently introduced a privacy block feature that can optionally use PipeWire to indicate if the microphone or webcam is currently in use. This functionality is enabled by setting a feature flag.

I have tested this feature with a webcam, and the indicator functioned correctly.

Resolves #316863

Things done

  • Built on platform(s)
    • x86_64-linux
    • aarch64-linux
    • x86_64-darwin
    • aarch64-darwin

    • sandbox = relaxed

items.title: i3status-rust: add optional support for pipewire driver

items.content_html:
Automatic update generated by nixpkgs-update tools. This update was made based on information from https://repology.org/project/obs-pipewire-audio-capture/versions.

meta.description for obs-studio-plugins.obs-pipewire-audio-capture is: Audio device and application capture for OBS Studio using PipeWire

meta.homepage for obs-studio-plugins.obs-pipewire-audio-capture is: https://github.com/dimtpap/obs-pipewire-audio-capture

Updates performed
  • Version update
To inspect upstream changes

  • Release on GitHub

  • Compare changes on GitHub

Impact

Checks done

  • built on NixOS
  • The tests defined in passthru.tests, if any, passed
  • found 1.1.5 in filename of file in /nix/store/sk328lj16yda10gaiiip42y1s4a7q1x1-obs-pipewire-audio-capture-1.1.5
Rebuild report (if merged into master) (click to expand) 
2 total rebuild path(s)

2 package rebuild(s)

First fifty rebuilds by attrpath

obs-studio-plugins.obs-pipewire-audio-capture
Instructions to test this update (click to expand)

Either download from Cachix:

nix-store -r /nix/store/sk328lj16yda10gaiiip42y1s4a7q1x1-obs-pipewire-audio-capture-1.1.5 \
  --option binary-caches 'https://cache.nixos.org/ https://nix-community.cachix.org/' \
  --option trusted-public-keys '
  nix-community.cachix.org-1:mB9FSh9qf2dCimDSUo8Zy7bkq5CX+/rkCWyvRCYg3Fs=
  cache.nixos.org-1:6NCHdD59X431o0gWypbMrAURkbJ16ZPMQFGspcDShjY=
  '

(The Cachix cache is only trusted for this store-path realization.)
For the Cachix download to work, your user must be in the trusted-users list or you can use sudo since root is effectively trusted.

Or, build yourself:

nix-build -A obs-studio-plugins.obs-pipewire-audio-capture https://github.com/r-ryantm/nixpkgs/archive/679697d62304f14cce0f3c4ec555eae3b56f7f60.tar.gz

Or:

nix build github:r-ryantm/nixpkgs/679697d62304f14cce0f3c4ec555eae3b56f7f60#obs-studio-plugins.obs-pipewire-audio-capture

After you've downloaded or built it, look at the files and if there are any, run the binaries:

ls -la /nix/store/sk328lj16yda10gaiiip42y1s4a7q1x1-obs-pipewire-audio-capture-1.1.5
ls -la /nix/store/sk328lj16yda10gaiiip42y1s4a7q1x1-obs-pipewire-audio-capture-1.1.5/bin

this change.

Note sometimes packages show up as failed to build independent of the
change, simply because they are already broken on the target branch.

items.title: obs-studio-plugins.obs-pipewire-audio-capture: 1.1.3 -> 1.1.5

items.content_html:
Description of changes

In order to successfully connect bluetooth audio devices, pipewire must be running already which it might not when socketActivation is enabled.
-> disabling socketActivation is a better default as it provides the more stable user experience

Things done
